channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed - eurogamer_net
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for eurogamer_net

item.title: Puppet-fronted comedy fighter Felt That: Boxing announced at Summer Game Fest
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/puppet-fronted-comedy-fighter-felt-that-boxing-announced-at-summer-game-fest

Geoff Keighley likes his puppets, so he told us during this evening's Summer Game Fest opening night, so it seems fitting that he introduced us all to a puppet-fronted boxing game. Yes, you read that right. A puppet-fronted boxing game.

It's known as Felt That: Boxing, and is described as a "comedic boxing game set in a world where the charm of furry puppets collides with the fury of boxing". Players will step into the shoes of Ezra "Fuzz-E" Wright, who developer Sans Strings Studio (Oh, I get it) described as "an unlikely hero with a big heart".

Anyway, Fuzz-E has a quest, and in a tale as old as time, he has to battle his way through punch after punch after punch to save an orphanage. You can check out a trailer for Felt That: Boxing below.

Felt That: Boxing doesn't have a release date yet, but you can check out its Steam page here.

Elsewhere this evening, we also got a look at Code Vein 2 and a fresh set of faces joining Sonic Racing CrossWorlds.

item.title: Onimusha; Way of the Sword gets a new gameplay trailer at Summer Game Fest
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/onimusha-way-of-the-sword-gets-a-new-gameplay-trailer-at-summer-game-fest

Onimusha: Way of the Sword has made an appearance at Summer Game Fest, courtesy of a gameplay trailer. It's set to release in 2026 on the PS5, Xbox, and Steam, and will be playable at Gamescom.

This trailer showcases a variety of combat encounters, some of the techniques at your disposal, and a suite of daunting looking enemies that you'll have to cut and slice your way through.

We also get a peak at a rival of sorts, who crosses swords with Musashi and talks a lot of trash while doing so.

Onimusha Way of the Sword was first revealed at The Game Awards last year, and took the spotlight as one of the highlights of that show. Earlier this year we got the first peek at gameplay, which is well worth checking out if you're hungry for everything Onimusha.

item.title: Hatsune Miku, Persona's Joker, and Minecraft's Steve join the roster for Sonic CrossWorlds
item.content:encoded:
https://www.eurogamer.net/hatsune-miku-personas-joker-and-minecrafts-steve-join-the-roster-for-sonic-crossworlds

The roster of Sonic Racing CrossWorlds is expanding outside of the Sonic universe to include other Sega characters and beyond.

As announced at tonight's Summer Game Fest, joining the likes of Sonic, Tails and Knuckles will be Joker from Persona 5 and Ichiban from the Like A Dragon games.

What's more, Vocaloid artist Hatsune Miku is joining too, along with Steve from Minecraft.

Sonic Team's Takashi Iizuka took to the stage at the event to - in tongue-in-cheek fashion - announce Sonic Racing CrossWorlds will have cross-play, unlike a "certain other kart racer".

Sonic Racing CrossWorlds is the latest in the Sonic racing series, introducing Travel Rings that transport racers to other dimensions.

It's set for release on 25th September across PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, Nintendo Switch, and PC (Steam, Epic).
